frame.name: Entering_of_plea
frame.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Accused</fen> enters a <fen>Plea</fen> in answer to the <fen>Charges</fen>. In most jurisdictions, the possible pleas are innocent, guilty, or nolo contendere. Accused persons may stand mute, in which case, the court usually enters a plea on their behalf.
<ex></ex> <ex>He made it clear that <fex name="Accused">he</fex> would <t>plead</t> <fex name="Plea">guilty</fex> <fex name="Charges">to indecent assault</fex>.</ex>
<ex>An <fex name="Plea">innocent</fex> <t>plea</t> was <m>entered</m> on her behalf <fex name="Judge">by a judge</fex> <fex name="Time">at an earlier hearing</fex>.</ex> Compare to: Citing. </def-root>

FE.name: Judge
FE.definition: <def-root>The judge of the court in which the accused enters a plea.</def-root>

FE.name: Accused
FE.definition: <def-root>The person entering the plea in court. <ex><fex name="Accused">Joy Peterson</fex> <t>pleaded</t> <fex name="Plea">innocent</fex> <fex name="Charges">to the murder of his son</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Charges
FE.definition: <def-root>The crime with which the Accused is charged <ex><fex name="Accused">Simpson</fex> <t>pleaded</t> <fex name="Plea">not guilty</fex> <fex name="Charges">to the murder of his wife</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Plea
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Plea</fen> that a defendant makes. <ex><fex name="Accused">The student</fex> <t>pleaded</t> <fex name="Plea">guilty</fex><fex name="Charges"> to stealing a bike</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Court
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Court</fen> is the institution before which the plea is entered.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: plead.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: enter a plea, usually "innocent' or "guilty".

lexUnit.name: plea.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a formal statement by or on behalf of a defendant or prisoner, stating guilt or innocence in response to a charge, offering an allegation of fact, or claiming that a point of law should apply.
